decision_conditions: It is recommended that these Sycamore trees, along the back of the garden bordering 15 Gidea Close, which is within the Gidea Park Conservation Area. These three trees can be overall crown reduced to previous pruning points and the branches growing over adjacent neighbours outbuilding reduced by up to 40%.

It is suggested that you engage the services of a qualified and fully insured tree surgeon to carry out the above work on your behalf (you should ask to see the contractor's insurance certificate and make sure that it is up to date).
The applicant is advised that if you wish to carry out further works to the above trees you will need to obtain our further consent.

You should comply with British Standard No. 3998 'Recommendations for Tree Work' a copy of which can be inspected at this office. You are advised that the work should be undertaken by a competent and suitably qualified tree contractor.
description:
I would like to reduce the trees back to at least the previous prune point.
There are 3 sycamore tress to the rear of the garden, 2 are contained in a retaining wall.  All 3 create excessive shade.  The 2 that are in the retaining wall are extremely large and the right hand side tree is has large branches growing across a neighbours outbuilding.
